intro: Paivaea phaea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf paivaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest size. Paivaea phaea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
